definition: to digress/to get sidetracked/to go off on a tangent
to pull/to tear/(of cloth, thread etc) to buy/to chat/to gossip/(coll.) (Tw) ridiculous/hokey
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

sentences.english: Withdrawn far, mocking me with mock-congratulatory signs and bows.
sentences.chinese: 扯远些，让嘲弄的道贺躬影嘲笑也不着急。

sentences.english: At least one member of the audience, a gray-haired man, seemed to think that this was going a bit too far.
sentences.chinese: 最后一个灰头发的男人认为这个话题扯远了。

sentences.english: You take our topic too far.

definition: to digress/to stray from the topic
to return to the topic (idiom)/to get back to the main point
modal particle indicating that sth is obvious/particle indicating a pause for emphasis
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
best not to mention it/drop it/never mind/let's not talk about it
we or us (including both the speaker and the person(s) spoken to)/(dialect) I or me/(dialect) (in a coaxing or familiar way) you/also pr. [za2 men5]
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
to play the same old tune (idiom); unoriginal
interjection indicating approval, appreciation or agreement
interjection or grunt of agreement or recognition (e.g. yes, it's me!)/to sigh
